post: 📜  #OTD in 1791, the Bill of Rights was ratified, securing protections for speech, religion, due process, and more. In this short video, we explore how those amendments continue to shape American civic life today. How do you help students connect rights to responsibilities? 🔗 Lesson:  https://bit.ly/3uYGs7m  #TDiH  #BillOfRights  #CivicEducation  #AmericanHistory

On Bill of Rights Day, BRI president Dr. David Bobb joined C-SPANs Washington Journal to trace how the first ten amendments were won, why they still matter, and why civil disagreement is essential to citizenship. How do you help students mark this day? 🔗 Watch:  https://lnkd.in/ePMVY2rx  #BillOfRightsDay  #BillOfRights  #CivicEducation  #TeachingHistory

Debating Matters: Transatlantic brings U. S. high schoolers and U. K. sixth formers together to debate global issues affecting both nations. Students sharpen their arguments, compare perspectives, and practice civil discourse with peers across the Atlantic. Which students in your network should be in that conversation? Share this with them. 🔗  https://lnkd.in/epxBrefs  #DebatingMatters  #DMTA  #CivicEducation  #YouthLeadership  #Debate

The 2026 National Civics Bee helps students practice real civic skills, like researching issues, writing clearly, and answering BRI-designed civics questions in the live competition. Along the way, they build confidence, public speaking skills, and deepen their sense of civic responsibility. How could your students benefit from this experience? 🔗 Discover more:  https://lnkd.in/esNd4QDK  #NationalCivicsBee  #CivicEducation  #StudentVoice  #PublicSpeaking  #YouthLeadership

Friendly challenge: Which state will put the most Pocket Constitutions into students hands this month? $1 = 1 copy. $10 = 10 students. $25 = a class set. $100 = a grade level. Back your state and tag a friend to join you:  https://bit.ly/40EsBAg  #CivicsChampion  #StatePride  #CivicEducation  #SupportTeachers

One teacher can start the momentum, many teachers can transform a school. Every logged activity adds another Civic Star entry for your campus. Tag a colleague who would want to join this month. 🔗  https://bit.ly/3V1CQuX  #CivicStarChallenge  #TeacherCollaboration  #CivicEducation  #America250  #K12

As November wraps up, BRI has been on the road, from Virginia Tech to New Mexico, helping teachers connect state standards with classroom-ready civics resources like our Government and Politics curriculum, tabletop games, and standards alignment tool. One participant shared, I really didnt know the breadth of the BRI resources.  How are you supporting educators as expectations for history and civics continue to evolve? Read the full recap:  https://bit.ly/48vY9fT  #CivicEducation  #TeachingHistory  #TeacherPD

The Debate & Leadership Institute, hosted by Founding Forward and the Bill of Rights Institute, brings rising 10th-12th graders to Valley Forge for 5 days of debate training, civic learning, and historic site visits in Philadelphia. Know a student who would thrive in this setting? Share this with them. 🔗  https://lnkd.in/erA2KXha  #DebateAndLeadershipInstitute  #CivicEducation  #YouthLeadership  #PublicSpeaking  #CollegeReady

As the year ends, its a perfect moment for students to reflect on their impact. Big or small, those actions can become a MyImpact Challenge submission. What student-led service stood out this year? Details:  https://lnkd.in/gagj58zD  #MyImpactChallenge  #CivicLeadership  #YouthDevelopment  #ServiceLearning

From regional Bees to the national championship, students will face BRI-designed civics questions and experiences at every level of the 2026 National Civics Bee Students competing for recognition and prizes, including a $100,000 education savings plan contribution for the national champion. Which students in your network should know about this? 🔗 How it works:  https://lnkd.in/esNd4QDK  #NationalCivicsBee  #CivicEducation  #YouthLeadership  #StudentAchievement
